alert_headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 16 at 8:00PM PDT until August 17 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Elko NV
alert_description:
* Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 437 Humboldt County-Quinn.

* Winds...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts near 40 mph.

* Relative Humidity...As low as 8 percent.

* Impacts...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity
will create critical fire weather conditions.
alert_instruction:
A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions
are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of
strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can
contribute to extreme fire behavior.
alert_cap_headline: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM PDT SATURDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 437

alert_area_desc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Mono; Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake
alert_headline: Lake Wind Advisory issued August 16 at 1:38PM PDT until August 17 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
alert_description:
* WHAT...Southwest winds 15 to 20 mph with gusts 30 to 40 mph and
waves up to 3 feet for Lake Tahoe, Pyramid Lake, Topaz Lake,
Bridgeport Reservoir, Mono Lake, Crowley Lake and Washoe Lake.

* WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area, Mono County, Greater Reno-Carson
City-Minden Area, and Western Nevada Basin and Range including
Pyramid Lake.

* WHEN...From 11 AM to 8 PM PDT Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Small boats, kayaks and paddle boards will be prone to
capsizing and should remain off lake waters until conditions
improve.
alert_instruction:
Check lake conditions before heading out and be prepared for a
sudden increase in winds and wave heights. Consider postponing
boating activities on the lake until a day with less wind.
alert_cap_headline: LAKE WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM PDT SATURDAY

alert_area_desc: Greater Lake Tahoe and Truckee Area; Southern Mono County; Eastern Lassen County; Northern Sierra Front - Carson City/Douglas/Storey/Southern Washoe/Eastern Lyon/Far Southern Lassen Counties; Southern Sierra Front - Alpine/Northern Mono/Southern Lyon/Western Mineral Counties; Northern Washoe County
alert_headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 16 at 1:37PM PDT until August 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
alert_description:
The National Weather Service in Reno has issued a Red Flag
Warning for gusty winds and low humidity, which is in effect from
11 AM to 11 PM PDT Saturday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer
in effect.

* CHANGES...Upgraded the Fire Weather Watch to a Red Flag Warning.

* Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 272 Greater Lake Tahoe and
Truckee Area, Fire Weather Zone 274 Southern Mono County, Fire
Weather Zone 278 Eastern Lassen County, Fire Weather Zone 420
Northern Sierra Front including Carson City, Douglas, Storey,
Southern Washoe, Western Lyon, and Far Southern Lassen
Counties, Fire Weather Zone 421 Southern Sierra Front
including Alpine, Northern Mono, Southern Lyon, and Western
Mineral Counties and Fire Weather Zone 458 Northern Washoe
County.

* Winds...South to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts 30 to 40 mph.

* Humidity...9 to 15%

* Duration...3 to 6 hours. Peak winds noon until 8 PM.

* Impacts...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can
cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first
responders can contain them.
alert_instruction:
Avoid outdoor activities that can cause a spark near dry
vegetation, such as yard work, target shooting, or campfires.
Follow local fire restrictions. Check weather.gov/reno for
updates and livingwithfire.info for preparedness tips.
alert_cap_headline: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 11 PM PDT SATURDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF WESTERN NEVADA AND NORTHEASTERN CALIFORNIA

alert_area_desc: Esmeralda and Nye County Deserts/CNC Dispatch; Nye County Deserts/Las Vegas Dispatch
alert_headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 16 at 11:10AM PDT until August 18 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
alert_description:
Southerly to southwesterly winds will increase over the weekend
as a trough digs along the West Coast. These winds combined with
afternoon relative humidities around 10% to 15% and dry fuels
will result in critical fire weather conditions across Esmeralda
and Nye Counties in southern Nevada. Winds will drop off and
relative humidities will recover Saturday night into Sunday
morning before critical conditions return Sunday afternoon.

* AFFECTED AREA...In Nevada...Fire weather zones 460 and 462.

* TIMING...1100 AM PDT Saturday through 800 PM PDT Sunday.

* WIND...15 to 25 mph southerly winds with gusts around 35 mph.

* HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent.

* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
Outdoor burning is not recommended.
alert_instruction:
A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions
are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of
strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can
contribute to extreme fire behavior.
alert_cap_headline: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SATURDAY TO 8 PM PDT SUNDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY
